meanings.sent1: The city plans to redevelop the old park into a new playground.
meanings.sent2: They decided to redevelop the website to make it more user-friendly.
meanings.sent3: I heard they want to redevelop the recipe for the famous cake.
meanings.sent4: She aimed to redevelop her painting style to be more abstract.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to redevelop the experiment after the first results were inconclusive.

meanings.definition: To renovate or improve a building or area.
meanings.sent1: The company will redevelop the historic building into a modern office space.
meanings.sent2: The city council approved the plan to redevelop the downtown area.
meanings.sent3: They joked that they should redevelop the office coffee machine to make better coffee.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to redevelop the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's vision was to redevelop the mural to reflect the community's diversity.
